errors.error_description: The pip installation command in the 'Quick Start' section has incorrect syntax, which will cause the command to fail.
The command to install from GitHub does not specify a branch or commit reference. This will install from the default branch, which might be an unstable or unintended version of the code.
The instructions for installing from a local clone have an incorrect logical order. It directs the user to run `pip install .` before navigating into the cloned repository directory, which will fail.
correction_candidates: First, clone the repository. Then, from the parent directory of the clone, run `pip install ./baybe`.
First, run `pip install .` from any directory. Then, clone the repository and navigate to the root folder.
First, clone the repository, navigate to the repository root folder, check out the desired commit, and run: `pip install .`
First, clone the repository and check out the desired commit. Then, from the repository root, run `python setup.py install`.
errors.golden_answer: First, clone the repository, navigate to the repository root folder, check out the desired commit, and run: `pip install .`
